title: A is twices as good a workman as B and both can finish a job in 14 days. In how many days will B finish a work alone? - Quora

response.answer_text: Method 1: Let B does 1 part/daySo, A does 2 parts/day(A+B) together complete 3 parts/dayThey take 14 days togetherSo, TOTAL WORK =14×3==14×3= 42 partsSo, time taken by B alone =421==421= 42 Days Thus, B alone takes 42 days42 days to complete the task.  Method 2: As A is twice as efficient as B, so while working together A does 2323rd of the work and B does 1313rd of the work. B completes 1313rd of the Total Work in 14 DaysSo, to do the TOTAL WORK, time taken would be thrice of 14 days.So, B takes14×3=14×3= 42 Days42 Days to complete the task alone

Let A take x days to do a work, alone. So he does (1/x)th of the work in a day. Let B take 2x days to do a work, alone. So he does (1/2x)th of the work in a day. A and B together do (1/x)+(1/2x) = (3/2x)th of the work in a day. So they take 2x/3 = 14 days, or x = 21. So B will do the work in 42 days, working alone. Check: (1/21)+(1/42) = (2/42)+(1/42) = (3/42) = 1/14. Or A and B do it in 14 days. Correct.
